DataElement.preferredName: Patient Part Time Employment Due To Radiation Therapy Hour Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the number of hours the patient reduced to part-time employment due to radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Part Time Employment Due To Radiation Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Employment involving less than the standard or customary working time._Caused by or resulting from._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Part Time Employment Due To Radiation Therapy
Property.preferredDefinition: Employment involving less than the standard or customary working time.:Caused by or resulting from.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Employment involving less than the standard or customary working time.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 03/26/2018: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number to represent a unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: If part-time, number of hours
ReferenceDocuments.description: If part-time, number of hours reduced from typical work day
